TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: Manages sellability and advertising of objects on retail lots.

TunableVariant.name: advertises
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this object will contribute to the curb appeal for the retail lot on which it is placed. Curb appeal affects foot traffic for the store as well as the type of clientele.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Curb appeal advertise tuning for the Retail Component.

Tunable.name: base_curb_appeal
Tunable.description: The amount of curb appeal this object should add just for being on the retail lot. Curb appeal affects the number of customers the store draws in. Sim counts can be tuned in the Retail Customer tuning.

TunableList.name: state_based_curb_appeal
TunableList.description: A mapping of states and the amount of curb appeal to add/subtract when the object is in that state. When an object changes out of these states, the curb appeal will be reverted back.

Tunable.name: Curb_Appeal_Adjustmnet
Tunable.description: The curb appeal to apply to the retail lot when the object is in the specified state.

Tunable.name: Retail_Object_State
Tunable.description: The object state the retail object should be in for the

TunableVariant.name: sellable
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this object can be sold on a retail lot.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The data associated with selling this item.

TunableList.name: allowed_occupied_slots_for_sellable
TunableList.description: By default, an object will become unsellable if anything is parented to it. This is to prevent awkward scenarios such as selling a counter with a sink is parented, leaving the sink floating in mid-air. However, some slots on objects are okay occupied, e.g. a table should still be sellable if chairs are parented. Adding those slots to this set (e.g. slot_SitChair on tables) will allow this object to remain sellable even if those slots are occupied.

Tunable.name: browse_affordance
Tunable.description: The affordance a Sim will run to browse retail objects.

Tunable.name: buy_affordance
Tunable.description: The affordance a Sim will run to buy retail objects. This affordance should handle destroying the object and adding the money to the retail funds.

Tunable.name: clear_placard_affordance
Tunable.description: The affordance a Sim will run to remove a placard from the lot.

TunableList.name: for_sale_extra_affordances
TunableList.description: When this object is marked For Sale, these are the extra interactions that will still be available. For instance, a debug interaction to sell the object could go here or you may want Sit to still be on chairs so customers can try them out. You may also want Clean on anything that can get dirty so employees can clean them. Note: These interactions are specific to this object. Do not add interactions that don't make sense for this object.

Tunable.description: The affordance to be left available on the object.

TunableVariant.name: placard_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, we will only use this placard when this object is sold. If disabled, the game will attempt to smartly choose a placard.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The placard and vfx to use for this object.

Tunable.name: model
Tunable.description: The placard to use when this object is sold.

TunableTuple.name: vfx
TunableTuple.description: The effect to play when the object is sold.

Tunable.name: effect_name
Tunable.description: The name of the effect to play.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the visual effect is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot.

Tunable.name: Slot
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this effect is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_immediate
Tunable.description: If checked, this effect will be triggered immediately, nothing will block. ex. VFX will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableList.name: restock_affordances
TunableList.description: The affordances a Sim will run to restock retail objects.

Tunable.name: set_for_sale_affordance
Tunable.description: The affordance a Sim will run to set a retail object as For Sale.

Tunable.name: set_not_for_sale_affordance
Tunable.description: The affordance a Sim will run to set a retail object as Not For Sale.
